title: Georgia House - Day 4 (2026-01-11)
summary:
Overview:
The Georgia House session on January 11, 2026 featured a devotional and prayer led by Reverend West Sarls, as well as a pledge of allegiance. The session did not involve any substantive legislative action, with the focus being on inspirational remarks and setting the tone for the day.

Key Actions: 
No bills were passed or referred during this session.

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
No new bills were introduced.

Notable Moments:
- Reverend Sarls delivered an inspirational message encouraging lawmakers to live lives of significance and be "make it happen people" who make a positive difference.
- Reverend Sarls reflected on the history and importance of the legislative chamber.
- Reverend Sarls quoted theologians and coaches to emphasize the value of purpose, integrity, and service to others.

Votes:
No recorded votes took place.

Attendance:
A quorum was present, as the House chambers were noted to have a "good crowd."

Adjournment:
The session adjourned after the pledge of allegiance. The next session date was not specified.
